intro: Lepidium nesophilum, commonly known as the alpine cress, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Lepidium nesophilum is valued for its ornamental qualities and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
